{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3461100,"name":"antoine schneider","username":"sun167","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b5e925/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-18T23:08:00.017Z","cooked":"

Hey, my team is looking to buy the new radio and there’s a lot we dont understand, in the documentation theres a mention of buying the vh-113 directly without having to convert it but i cant seem to find it and they also talk about the poe wall adapter vh-117 that i also cant seem to find. does anyone know where i can buy these ?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2024-12-18T23:08:00.017Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":364,"reads":211,"readers_count":210,"score":1877.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":476995,"topic_slug":"where-to-find-the-new-frc-radio","display_username":"antoine schneider","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51978,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/where-to-find-the-new-frc-radio/476995/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3461101,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-18T23:12:19.135Z","cooked":"

VH-113 is only needed if you want to run a full field of 6 robots for a sustained period of time…i.e. if you host scrimmages or offseason events.

It is not currently for sale. We are pending its release date.

VH-117 is a wall adapter to power the VH-109 or VH-113. It is for sale at WCP currently but as of the last week+ on backorder.

VH-109 is the robot radio itself. You can use 2 of these to set up a robot and a driverstation to communicate with eachother. You can even use practice-at-home firmware for the VH-109, a heatsink at the same link above from WCP (or build your own heatsink), and a managed network switch to run multiple robots “at home” (your practice area). Or firmware to provide VH-113 functionality on the VH-109 to run a full field - but your radio will need heatsinking as mentioned above as well
